stx.framework.Injector

type
class
Featherweight injection library. 
  import stx.framework.Injector;

  ...

  Injector.enter(
   function(config) {
     config.bind(Clock, SystemClock, OneToMany);
     config.inClass(ClockConsumer).bind(Clock, MockClock);

     myApp.run();

     return Unit;
   }
  );
Interfaces can specify a default implementation by adding the following metadata to the interface itself:

Static Methods

enter<T>(f : InjectorConfig -> T) : T

parameters
f The module, which should specify the configuration and run the associated code.
The entry point for a module. This is how an application specifies the configuration.

forever<T>(f : InjectorConfig -> T) : T

inject<T>(interf : Class<T>, ?pos : haxe.PosInfos) : T

Injects an implementation of the specified interface. The implementation will be chosen based on the current bindings.
